Speaker: resident evil
Dialogue: ORIGINAL SCREENPLAY BY GEORGE A. ROMERO

Speaker: screen story
Dialogue: BY GEORGE A. ROMERO & PETER GRUNWALD

Speaker: constantin film
Dialogue: ROMERO-GRUNWALD PRODUCTIONS

Speaker: first draft
Dialogue: OCTOBER 7, 1998

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Take it, Goliath. It's yours.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Glad you're still here, lady

Speaker: jill
Dialogue: It's my apartment.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: You're awake.

Speaker: jill
Dialogue: I've been awake. Since you left.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Sorry.

Speaker: jill
Dialogue: What, with my dinner? I never had a mother. I'll learn.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: I'll do the cooking.

Speaker: jill
Dialogue: There are probably all kinds of things prowling around up there. In the middle of the night.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: I'm sorry. Really. You...have to be there at dawn. They ride the wind over the ridge.

Speaker: jill
Dialogue: Dawn? You left at one A.M.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: I had to go fishing. It's the fish that bring them down, so I can get a close look at them.  I've tracked a dozen of them, Jill. Twelve of those big bruisers. I can actually recognize them. I've even given them names, over the years.

Speaker: jill
Dialogue: You've been doing this for years?

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Only in the early Autumn. When they're' migrating.

Speaker: jill
Dialogue: I'II set the alarm for next. October.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Beauty... isn't simple. If it was... I'd be beautiful.

Speaker: jill
Dialogue: You are.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: No, no, no.  I'm simple.  You, on the other hand......have all that... stuff... hiding underneath somewhere. That's what fascinates me.

Speaker: jill
Dialogue: Fascination. Not love?

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: I... honestly don't know. I guess I've been... living alone too long. You're the first, the only woman I've ever thought of as... a real partner.

Speaker: jill
Dialogue: I've always been...afraid of living alone. I've always had... people... talking at me... knowing they could wind me up and I'd do...  ... whatever they wanted.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: I'm part Mohawk. Indians are never confused. At least, they never let it show.

Speaker: rake
Dialogue: Get in there, Lucky. Quit horsin' around. Get in.

Speaker: radio man
Dialogue: Top brass, sir!

Speaker: jill
Dialogue: Valentine.

Speaker: disimone
Dialogue: Another practice run, right?

Speaker: russo
Dialogue: We been practicin' six months! For what?

Speaker: jill
Dialogue: For this. This is the real deal.

Speaker: williams
Dialogue: Honest to God?

Speaker: jill
Dialogue: Based on my experience, Williams, God isn't always honest

Speaker: disimone
Dialogue: Where we goin'?

Speaker: jill
Dialogue: In there.

Speaker: russo
Dialogue: If you had the jing to build a place like this, would you build it in the middle of fuckin' nowhere?

Speaker: williams
Dialogue: Paris.

Speaker: disimone
Dialogue: Manhattan. Upper west.

Speaker: jill
Dialogue: Our orders are to secure the area.

Speaker: disimone
Dialogue: From what? This area's been 'secure' since the French and Indian War!

Speaker: jill
Dialogue: This is Valentine, Bravo Team. We, er... we might be in trouble, here.

Speaker: wesker
Dialogue: Can you get a trace?

Speaker: laguardia
Dialogue: Lost the beacon. It just cut out. Like it was...swallowed by something.

Speaker: wesker
Dialogue: I do believe, gentlemen...that we're gonna be earning some combat pay.

Speaker: barry
Dialogue: Damn, if you don't love a fight.

Speaker: wesker
Dialogue: Hey, if I didn't... you'd be a dead man.  Call in a nine- nine. I want Raccoon City e-vacked.

Speaker: bullhorn
Dialogue: There's been an accident in the hills nearby. A military aircraft, carrying live weapons, has crashed...

Speaker: soldier
Dialogue: Let's go, hayseed.  You gonna be a good boy?

Speaker: man
Dialogue: Look here, I'm the Sheriff of this...

Speaker: soldier
Dialogue: Step aside.

Speaker: sheriff
Dialogue: But, I'm the Sheriff! An ex-Army man, like you.

Speaker: sherriff
Dialogue: That's a worn-out scenario. If a plane crashed nearby, don't you think somebody would have heard it go down? Tell us the truth, guys. What's this really about?

Speaker: soldier
Dialogue: I said, STEP ASIDE!

Speaker: wesker
Dialogue: Charlie, David, Edward, proceed to Raccoon City. Assist the e-vack. I'm going on target with Alpha Team. All forces stand ready to support.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Aw, no...  ...L-Lucky.

Speaker: rake
Dialogue: They... they come outta the trees, Reddy. Don't... don't know what they was. Figure... maybe some kinda... wolves, or somethin' ...

Speaker: rake
Dialogue: I... I never seen 'em comin'.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Don't try to talk, Rake.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: I know. You... kept the place runnin'... better than me.

Speaker: rake
Dialogue: I just...never seen 'em comin', Reddy. Never even...had a chance to...turn a gun on 'em.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Where are they going? There's nothing in there... except...

Speaker: rake
Dialogue: Y'oughta... remember it... real good. I do.  From... when you was a kid.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: The... the old Arkley place?

Speaker: rake
Dialogue: I remember them days. I surely do... Remember them... them old days.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Oh, God, Rake. Oh, Jesus, the poor thing's still alive.

Speaker: wesker
Dialogue: You'll have to rotate or you'll run out of fuel, but I want one chopper to remain in the air at all times. We might need help in a hurry.

Speaker: vickers
Dialogue: Holy... Goh... gaah...

Speaker: aiken
Dialogue: You ever eat road-kill, Sullivan?

Speaker: sullivan
Dialogue: Aiken... a guy with a brain your size would be better off dead.

Speaker: alken
Dialogue: I'll pass. Shoot Sullivan.

Speaker: wesker
Dialogue: Radio Washington.  Bravo Team found on site. No survivors.

Speaker: wesker
Dialogue: We're goin' in.  Watch your backs.

Speaker: wesker
Dialogue: Who fired? WHO FIRED?

Speaker: rodriguez
Dialogue: Let's get inside.

Speaker: barry
Dialogue: Even-Steven, boss.  You saved my ass in the desert.  I saved yours I in Pennsylvania.

Speaker: wesker
Dialogue: I don't believe in being... 'Even- Steven' with anybody.  A man saves my ass...I pay him back.  Before this day is over, I'll pay you back, Barry.  Just... stick with me, okay?

Speaker: barry
Dialogue: Look here, man.  I'd follow you into any kind of enemy fire.  But these things ain't firin' at us. They want us for breakfast!  When are you gonna tell us what the hell is goin' on here?

Speaker: wesker
Dialogue: When you need to know.  Just do your job, soldier.  That's what I'm doin'.  My job.

Speaker: aiken
Dialogue: Old. They probably don't have cable.

Speaker: sullivan
Dialogue: They probably don't have radio.

Speaker: rodriguez
Dialogue: Who's they? Who's place is this?

Speaker: wesker
Dialogue: Guy named Arkley.  Bootlegger.  Built this old fortress during prohibition. He figured nobody'd ever find him out here in the back woods.  Nobody did. Till he died.  Feds have had it ever since.  Place has been here for eighty years... derelict... a safe-house.

Speaker: barry
Dialogue: A safe-house... for who? For what?

Speaker: wesker
Dialogue: There's a... a secret installation. Below.  A network of laboratories.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: What kind of... laboratories?

Speaker: wesker
Dialogue: They didn't issue us gas-masks, so I figure... it's okay to breathe.

Speaker: rodriguez
Dialogue: Why send in a strike-force?

Speaker: sullivan
Dialogue: Yeah. What are we supposed to do? Polish the silver?

Speaker: wesker
Dialogue: Three men stay here. Chambers...

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: I'm not a man.

Speaker: wesker
Dialogue: Rodriguez...

Speaker: rodriguez
Dialogue: I'm better than a man.

Speaker: wesker
Dialogue: Alright. you come with us. Aiken, Sullivan, stick here with Chambers.

Speaker: aiken
Dialogue: Why us?

Speaker: sullivan
Dialogue: I dunno why me. You? I guess the C.O. figures you're as worthless as a dame, Aiken.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: Relax. I get it.

Speaker: barry
Dialogue: That thing...tells you where to go?

Speaker: wesker
Dialogue: One man stays here. Ridley. You're it. Shoot to kill. Just make sure it's not one of us. The rest of you... this way.

Speaker: ridley
Dialogue: Who... who's there?

Speaker: ridley
Dialogue: Who are you?

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Who are YOU? What the hell is S.T.A.R.S.?

Speaker: ridley
Dialogue: How'd you get in here?

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Who sealed the door?

Speaker: ridley
Dialogue: Who knew there a door?

Speaker: ridley
Dialogue: Who... who... ?

Speaker: speyer
Dialogue: Where'd that come from?

Speaker: barry
Dialogue: Back...where we just were.

Speaker: speyer
Dialogue: Shit, man, we're chasin' our tails!

Speaker: speyer
Dialogue: Damn. Surnbitch took a lotta lead.

Speaker: barry
Dialogue: That's not what killed him. Blood's still running. Wounds are fresh. But look at his skin. This guy's been dead for a couple of days.

Speaker: rodriguez
Dialogue: He was dead... before he was shot?

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: I... I'm one of the good guys, okay I'm just trying to...

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: SULLIVAN! AIKEN!

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Shit.

Speaker: aiken
Dialogue: Who was that?

Speaker: sullivan
Dialogue: Forget him. What are they?

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Somebody did some major remodeling.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: We gotta get him out!

Speaker: aiken
Dialogue: What? Smart fuckin' plants?

Speaker: sullivan
Dialogue: No big deal. Most-plants are smarter than you, Aiken.

Speaker: speyer
Dialogue: Why would anyone shoot a dead man?

Speaker: rodriguez
Dialogue: Lemme guess. Maybe 'cause he was... walkin' around?

Speaker: barry
Dialogue: Head-shot. We were sprayin' those dogs outside... but think about it. Were any of 'em brought down without a head-shot.

Speaker: jill
Dialogue: I lost three me.  You killed them, Wesker. You did... and I did. Because I didn't know what to expect... because you... didn't tell me!

Speaker: wesker
Dialogue: Tell you what?

Speaker: jill
Dialogue: Anything! I wasn't told anything!

Speaker: wesker
Dialogue: Put down the gun.

Speaker: jill
Dialogue: Not until...

Speaker: wesker
Dialogue: RELEASE! THAT'S AN ORDER, SOLDIER!

Speaker: jill
Dialogue: How ya doin' , Valentine? Good to see ya. Glad you're still alive. Same here, colonel, I'm...

Speaker: wesker
Dialogue: How did you get in here?

Speaker: jill
Dialogue: I... locked them off.

Speaker: wesker
Dialogue: Good thinking.

Speaker: wesker
Dialogue: Ladies first.

Speaker: jill
Dialogue: Fuck you.

Speaker: rodriguez
Dialogue: Maybe... they're in the house. More of them dogs.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: Diameter's too small. It... almost looks as if... it was done by a...

Speaker: jill
Dialogue: A human?

Speaker: aiken
Dialogue: Not a vegetarian, that's for sure.

Speaker: sullivan
Dialogue: Aiken, you'd be better off...

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: There was a guy. Not part of the team. And there was... some kind of... plant... that seemed... alive.

Speaker: rodriguez
Dialogue: Gimme a fuckin' break.

Speaker: aiken
Dialogue: No shit. It disappeared... right into the wall.

Speaker: wesker
Dialogue: I guess it's... time to spill it.

Speaker: rodriguez
Dialogue: Speak English, hombre.

Speaker: wesker
Dialogue: Marcus has been experimenting with an artificial... man-made... virus. Coded...the 'T'-virus.  Financing came from a private corporation, you may have heard the name... Umbrella.

Speaker: jill
Dialogue: They're... multi-national. Huge.

Speaker: wesker
Dialogue: So huge that they have... connections... in high places.  That's why we're here.

Speaker: barry
Dialogue: This virus... it jumped, right?

Speaker: speyer
Dialogue: Shit! We're all dead! We got the bug, and we're all dead!

Speaker: wesker
Dialogue: It's not airborne. It was spread... in the water supply. Lab animals and... the researchers themselves... passed it on... by...

Speaker: jill
Dialogue: By... biting.

Speaker: barry
Dialogue: You catch this virus and... what?

Speaker: wesker
Dialogue: You die. But... not for long. The chemical...revives the brain, and...

Speaker: rodriguez
Dialogue: You stand back up... and chew on the first guy you see.

Speaker: speyer
Dialogue: Christ, this is like... Night of the Living Dead!

Speaker: barry
Dialogue: Why, in the name of Jesus, would anybody wanna mess with shit... that does that shit?

Speaker: wesker
Dialogue: Victory, friend. Civilization has come a long way, but we still have... war.  Imagine... a soldier who can't die.  That... was the concept.

Speaker: jill
Dialogue: But the virus... jumped.

Speaker: wesker
Dialogue: Hopefully... if we got all the dogs... we've contained it.

Speaker: jill
Dialogue: Hopefully?  Jesus... why didn't you tell us?

Speaker: wesker
Dialogue: By telling you NOW, I've put your lives in jeopardy. Nobody has this information. Except a few high-and- mightys. Me. And now, you.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: I don't know, this all sounds pretty shaky to me...

Speaker: rodriguez
Dialogue: Guess that proves it. A head-shot knocks 'em down.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: Th-that man.. .was dead.  I... I'm a doctor! I should know! That man was dead!

Speaker: vickers
Dialogue: I hope you have a lot of these.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Hey.

Speaker: aiken
Dialogue: Where the fuck is a shark's brain?

Speaker: sullivan
Dialogue: In it's head! I swear, Aiken, you would be better off dead.

Speaker: wesker
Dialogue: Nice. Very NICE, Valentine! You set off a containment breach!

Speaker: jill
Dialogue: It must have been the water. God, the water! (She turns to Chris} Did you swallow any?

Speaker: speyer
Dialogue: I did.

Speaker: sullivan
Dialogue: A bunch of us did, man.

Speaker: wesker
Dialogue: Separate systems. Salt water. No germs. But.. .it breached!

Speaker: rodriguez
Dialogue: So...we live here now.

Speaker: wesker
Dialogue: There are override exits... but I can't find them without THIS!

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: That was a smart move.

Speaker: wesker
Dialogue: And... you are?

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Nobody.  Just a...a local guy...

Speaker: wesker
Dialogue: Valentine...who is this asshole?

Speaker: jill
Dialogue: His name is Chris Redfield. He was... part of my cover, sir.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Cover?

Speaker: jill
Dialogue: This is not the time to mouth off, Chris! You're in deep shit here!

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Why didn't you let me in on this?

Speaker: jill
Dialogue: Why did you have to come after me? How did you get in here, anyway?

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: I used to play here, when this was a fucking laundry room!  And what makes you think I came after YOU?

Speaker: barry
Dialogue: Whoa! Look here.

Speaker: wesker
Dialogue: It...it once was.

Speaker: barry
Dialogue: A map. Same as on your gizmo. Exits marked...blue and green.

Speaker: wesker
Dialogue: The greens are the overrides.  Can you print this out?

Speaker: vickers
Dialogue: I can try.

Speaker: wesker
Dialogue: We have to get down to level 'D'.

Speaker: barry
Dialogue: Hold on. Marcus is dead. If this mission was about bringin' him out, we're outta here, right?

Speaker: wesker
Dialogue: I wish we were, but no. We have a potential outbreak here. We might be the only ones who can stop it.

Speaker: speyer
Dialogue: Stop it? How?

Speaker: wesker
Dialogue: There's... an antidote.

Speaker: jill
Dialogue: Not simple.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Not complicated, either. We only have to decide... what's right... and what's wrong.

Speaker: jill
Dialogue: I forgot. You're never confused. So...what's right, Mohawk? And what's wrong?

Speaker: vickers
Dialogue: Shit.  There are no green exits on this level. Why... why would that be?

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: They don't want anybody up here to go snoopin' ...upstairs or down.

Speaker: wesker
Dialogue: Pretty good guess. You must have been in the military, son.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Native American. Exempted.

Speaker: vickers
Dialogue: Fuck! There... there's no way out!

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Yes there is.

Speaker: wesker
Dialogue: Not a bad idea.  See if you can call up... service charts, schematics.

Speaker: vickers
Dialogue: Got it. Ceiling grids, ladders. The whole infrastructure.

Speaker: wesker
Dialogue: Print it. Print all of it.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: What's that from?

Speaker: vickers
Dialogue: I...snagged it. On the desk. When we were scrambling.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: Lemme look at it. VICKERS  No. It's just a scratch!

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: There's a... part of an old laundry chute. It might not show on there. It runs up to the kitchen.

Speaker: wesker
Dialogue: I'm not going up. I'm going down.

Speaker: jill
Dialogue: No objections. We'll back you up.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: You said... people wind you up and you do whatever they want you to do.

Speaker: wesker
Dialogue: Stay out of this, son. You're the only one who doesn't have a choice in this. There's no place to lock you up. I can't let you go, you're a security risk. I could shoot you. Legally. But your lady-friend would probably get all over my ass. So... I'm afraid you're comin' with us... whether you like it or not.  He's your responsibility, Valentine. See that he doesn't make trouble.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: You up to the challenge?

Speaker: jill
Dialogue: Try me.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: I already have.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Jill, I... I'm sorry. I'm just... angry. When I... thought you were gone, I... Then... when I saw you. Alive. I realized that...

Speaker: jill
Dialogue: That you were still... fascinated.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Stop. Stop!

Speaker: jill
Dialogue: I...I want to. I want... nothing more. But... I can't. When I'm in this uniform, I'm more than... just me. Try to understand...there's no "I" in Team, Chris.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: There's no "I" in DEAD, either.

Speaker: jill
Dialogue: You go. You're not part of this.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: I'm part of it as. long as you are.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: For me, too, brother.

Speaker: barry
Dialogue: I mean this...  It's very uncomfortable.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Eighteen years?

Speaker: barry
Dialogue: Yep. Two away from the big re-ti.

Speaker: jill
Dialogue: Desk job, right? Nobody lasts that long if they've seen action.

Speaker: barry
Dialogue: I've seen action in Granada.  And Desert Storm.  Would have lost it all there... if my buddy didn't bring in a team, against orders, to pull my ass out.  Buddy named... Wesker.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: You've been with this asshole since... ?

Speaker: barry
Dialogue: Since before that.  We were... kids together.  Macon, Georgia.  He's... only an asshole some of the time...

Speaker: vickers
Dialogue: Who knows what we'll find down there?

Speaker: aiken
Dialogue: Think positive.  The farther down we go, the worse it's gonna get.  So... until we hit bottom, we're in good shape... relatively speaking.

Speaker: speyer
Dialogue: What the fuck?

Speaker: vickers
Dialogue: Whatever it is.. .it can't get us. We're in the ceiling!

Speaker: aiken
Dialogue: Maybe it's like... really tall.

Speaker: sullivan
Dialogue: Aiken...

Speaker: wesker
Dialogue: Main-frame. Might have some data we could use.  Fox, Marini, Vickers.  Down.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: The man has balls, I'll say that.

Speaker: wesker
Dialogue: Hustle it, Vickers.  You're the guy we need.  To cut into the network.

Speaker: wesker
Dialogue: Watch these entrances, guys.

Speaker: vickers
Dialogue: AAAAH ! Shit.

Speaker: wesker
Dialogue: Hold tight. It doesn't sound like it's on this level.

Speaker: vickers
Dialogue: Shit. I'm locked out. Any clues for a password?

Speaker: wesker
Dialogue: Try... Umbrella.

Speaker: vickers
Dialogue: Nothing. Wait. I'm into... No. No data. Just some kind of video feed. Time-coded. Yesterday. It's a play-back.  Holy shit!

Speaker: fox
Dialogue: Maybe the ceiling's not such a safe place, after all.

Speaker: wesker
Dialogue: Scram! SCRAM!

Speaker: barry
Dialogue: Haul ass, boss!

Speaker: wesker
Dialogue: That's...two I owe ya.

Speaker: barry
Dialogue: One. We were all... 'Even-Steven' .

Speaker: wesker
Dialogue: Two. Remember? 'Even-Steven' ... is not in my vocabulary.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Those things could get up here. We can't let that happen. This is our way out...

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Caruso.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Thank you.

Speaker: jill
Dialogue: Any time. How do we get back UP?

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Shit, if you didn't have a plan, you shouldn't have jumped down here.

Speaker: jill
Dialogue: We have a real problem here, Chris.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: How big is this place? How many people were down here? How...

Speaker: jill
Dialogue: HOW DO WE GET UP?

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Big. Heavy.

Speaker: jill
Dialogue: It got you!

Speaker: barry
Dialogue: No skin broken. I'm alright.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: We owe you a pair of pants.

Speaker: wesker
Dialogue: Stand down. Five minutes.

Speaker: speyer
Dialogue: I'm through, Wesker.

Speaker: marini
Dialogue: Me too, man. This ain't nothin' I signed on for.

Speaker: wesker
Dialogue: You want to wait here, fine.

Speaker: marini
Dialogue: Wait here? No. We're gettin' out!

Speaker: wesker
Dialogue: You can't.  Not without this.

Speaker: speyer
Dialogue: Fuck you! And your fancy doors and your green key! The choppers have rockets. They can blow out a wall if they have to. I'm callin' 'em in.

Speaker: wesker
Dialogue: You wanna see a wall blow, I'll blow all of 'em for ya.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: You...lunatic! That damn thing can slip out of your ear by accident!

Speaker: wesker
Dialogue: That's right. It's your job...all of your jobs...to see that it doesn't. And to see that my heart... doesn't skip any beats.

Speaker: sullivan
Dialogue: Sumbitch might do it, Speyer.

Speaker: wesker
Dialogue: I'II be obliged to do it! If I don't get that antidote, I'll have to burn this place out!  Valentine. The radio.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: What are you, this guy's flunky? He just threatened to blow us all up, for Christ's sake!

Speaker: jill
Dialogue: That's what I'm trying to prevent!

Speaker: laguardia
Dialogue: How many digits did you receive?

Speaker: radio man
Dialogue: Six. The beginning of an air- support code, but... it just went dead on me.

Speaker: laguardia
Dialogue: Call S.T.A.R.S. in Washington. I want...

Speaker: radio man
Dialogue: Hold it...

Speaker: laguardia
Dialogue: Call Washington anyway. I want the authority to take action if necessary.

Speaker: radio man
Dialogue: No independent action.

Speaker: laguardia
Dialogue: Damn. I feel so fuckin'... helpless!

Speaker: wesker
Dialogue: You guys were hand-picked. A Special Unit. Most of you have been sitting on your asses, drawing pay checks for more than two years. Well... it's time to repay those... Government loans.

Speaker: speyer
Dialogue: Bull shit. I'm not...

Speaker: wesker
Dialogue: Pitch your empties. Put all your loaded clips on that crate there. I want a count. Then I want the rounds divvied up... evenly.

Speaker: aiken
Dialogue: Lingerie. Notions.

Speaker: wesker
Dialogue: GOD DAMMIT, NO MORE JOKES! We have men dead upstairs! This hell-hole is full of people who died... because of this stinkin' ...BUG!

Speaker: jill
Dialogue: Forty two.

Speaker: speyer
Dialogue: That's all we have?

Speaker: wesker
Dialogue: We weren't expecting a war, Speyer.  I'll take three. Three to your boyfriend...

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Don't need 'em. Got my own loads.

Speaker: wesker
Dialogue: Good. Then... we all get four clips.

Speaker: speyer
Dialogue: They must have... weapons down here, somewhere. A powder magazine.

Speaker: wesker
Dialogue: No more side trips. It was a mistake to go into that lab upstairs. My mistake. And I'm not makin' another one. From now on it's straight ahead. In and out.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Jill...this guy is a Loony-Toon.

Speaker: jill
Dialogue: He's just... trying to get the job done. Doing what he has to do.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Yeah, well...I hope you'll say the same about me... when I do... what I have to do.

Speaker: wesker
Dialogue: It's not clear... which way to go.

Speaker: rodriguez
Dialogue: Want me to flip a coin?

Speaker: sullivan
Dialogue: What's that sound like to you?

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: This is the heart of the whole place. They've got to have it... protected somehow.

Speaker: sullivan
Dialogue: There's no way outta this mousetrap!

Speaker: rodriguez
Dialogue: So we live here now?

Speaker: speyer
Dialogue: We gotta run for it.

Speaker: aiken
Dialogue: Bad idea, Speyer.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Down. Through these.

Speaker: vickers
Dialogue: Where do they go?

Speaker: sullivan
Dialogue: Does it matter?

Speaker: jill
Dialogue: On three...

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: One... two...

Speaker: jill
Dialogue: God...and it doesn't even stop them...

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: It's not meant to stop them. It's meant to stop...something else.

Speaker: speyer
Dialogue: We damn near got turned into Rice Krispies by that gizmo of yours. If you don't want me to nail that fuckin' thing into your ear, you deactivate it. Right now.

Speaker: wesker
Dialogue: I can't. They.. .fixed it... so you can't chicken out. The system can only be turned off at the main panel.

Speaker: barry
Dialogue: Where the hell is that?

Speaker: wesker
Dialogue: Where the explosives are. Down... farther than we need to go. We only have to make it down one more level. If... when... we make it back up to the choppers... we can fly out of the detonator's signal range.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: I'm not willing to rely on that. I live here, this is my town!

Speaker: wesker
Dialogue: The town's been evacuated. Just... just in case.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: That explains the lie. About the plane crash. An airplane down... with weapons on board... would nicely explain a big explosion, wouldn't it? You figured all along you might have to blow this place!

Speaker: wesker
Dialogue: I don't want to do it. I... I hope I don't have to.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: I...I can't let this happen. I've got to find that bomb.

Speaker: jill
Dialogue: I'll help. Once Wesker gets what he wants, my obligation is over.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: No. I want you out. With the rest of them. Wesker won't push the button until you're clear.

Speaker: jill
Dialogue: He doesn't want to push the button.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: He has to. Don't you see? He can't leave these labs here. And, Jesus... walking corpses! He's gotta get rid of the evidence.

Speaker: jill
Dialogue: Chris, no!

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: I've got to try and stop this.

Speaker: rodriguez
Dialogue: Shit. One thing after another.

Speaker: wesker
Dialogue: Sit tight. Ride it out.

Speaker: jill
Dialogue: CHRIS!

Speaker: wesker
Dialogue: This way.

Speaker: jill
Dialogue: No. That way.  Chris and the others...

Speaker: wesker
Dialogue: If they're dead, they're dead. If they're alive, they'll still be alive in twenty minutes. When we get back.

Speaker: jill
Dialogue: Maybe not. And how do we know it's only going to be twenty minutes? How do we know we'll be able to come back this way?

Speaker: wesker
Dialogue: We don't. But we'll do our damndest to try. This is it, guys. The home stretch. Let's go.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: Th-this thing was no accident. It was cultivated!

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: And it didn't rip out the ceiling for the fun of it. Stay alert.

Speaker: aiken
Dialogue: My mother made me eat vegetables. I know 'em all. This ain't one of 'em.

Speaker: sullivan
Dialogue: Aiken...

Speaker: aiken
Dialogue: Sullivan! JESUS, SULLIVAN!

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Get out of the away!

Speaker: aiken
Dialogue: They.. .they killed Sullivan. The bastards... whoever did this shit... they KILLED SULLIVAN!

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Hold this.

Speaker: aiken
Dialogue: K-kill me. S-Sullvan said...I'd be.. .better off dead. That...ain't never been truer than now. Kill me!

Speaker: holden
Dialogue: Keep us appraised.

Speaker: wesker
Dialogue: Where are the others?

Speaker: jill
Dialogue: Right behind me. Were you... talking to someone?

Speaker: wesker
Dialogue: To Washington. To my... superiors. They're your superiors too, Valentine. Don't forget that.

Speaker: barry
Dialogue: Nothin'. man. No doors. Nothin'. We hit a dead end.

Speaker: speyer
Dialogue: Us too. Cement wall.

Speaker: vickers
Dialogue: We're never gonna get to that lab.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: I... can't take this any more.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: We take what comes. That's the secret of our genius.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: Not very old at all. Not nearly old enough to...to...

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: None of us is old enough for that.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: Jill... told me... you were nice .

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: She did? She never told me.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Hurry.

Speaker: barry
Dialogue: Head shots. Ain't doin' nothin'!

Speaker: wesker
Dialogue: That was the idea.

Speaker: barry
Dialogue: What idea?

Speaker: wesker
Dialogue: To win. The idea was... to win.

Speaker: jill
Dialogue: Wing it!

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: You know...that just might be the ticket. Wing the fuckers.

Speaker: speyer
Dialogue: Run! We slowed 'em down. Run!

Speaker: barry
Dialogue: Where? As far as we'll get, either way, is a cement wall.

Speaker: ada
Dialogue: You lost a man. If I had only been faster. I was unfamiliar with the mechanism.

Speaker: ada
Dialogue: Don't worry, it's mindless. It doesn't realize that it's strong enough to push the door open.

Speaker: rodriguez
Dialogue: Hasn't happened to me, yet.

Speaker: ada
Dialogue: My... colleagues. Benjamin. Toshiro. As far as we know, we are the...only ones.. .left alive. We worked on "C" level. One of the biologists saved us. Brought us down here. He knew that... he didn't have long to live. He... started the mechanism... out there, in the corridor.. .and he let it... take him.

Speaker: rodriguez
Dialogue: You did fine, lady. We're obliged.

Speaker: ada
Dialogue: As are we.  We believed... we would die here. Believed...the bomb would destroy us.

Speaker: jill
Dialogue: You knew.. .about the bomb?

Speaker: ada
Dialogue: The end for a place like this, when it fails... must be a bomb, yes?

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: It... already came. ma'am. We brought it. The colonel, here... he's wearing it.

Speaker: ada
Dialogue: Is it true? Are you here to... rescue? Or destroy?

Speaker: wesker
Dialogue: Both.  If I have to pick only one... I'll pick destroy.

Speaker: ada
Dialogue: You're not S.T.A.R.S. You're Umbrella.

Speaker: wesker
Dialogue: Once again. Both.  Two salaries. Three if you count combat pay.

Speaker: ada
Dialogue: The man I loved, John Marcus... developed the organism that caused all this. He... he did it for humanitarian purposes. It was taken away from him...for in-human purposes...by men like you!

Speaker: wesker
Dialogue: No, ma'am. Men like me... are just errand boys. Sent in to do the wet-work. All of the glory. None of the benefits.

Speaker: ada
Dialogue: After what you've seen down here, do you think any of it could be turned into... benefit?

Speaker: wesker
Dialogue: Yes. I think it could be turned into five or ten million dollars. How do we get into "D" lab?

Speaker: ada
Dialogue: Death lab.  John was killed...never even knowing it existed. They kept him... isolated, upstairs, while a separate team was down here...corrupting his research. Using it to build B.O.W.s.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: B.O.W.s?

Speaker: ada
Dialogue: Bio-organic weapons.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: The sharks. The plant.

Speaker: ada
Dialogue: Early experiments.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: The snake.

Speaker: ada
Dialogue: A failure. Its behavior remained reptilian. All they could ever get it to do was... grow in size.

Speaker: rodriguez
Dialogue: Those dogs. They were weapons.

Speaker: ada
Dialogue: No. They... simply became infected. As did... everyone else. Janitors. The cook. Electricians. Guards. People who believed they were serving their flag. Scientists. Great minds... turned into mindless.. .ghouls!

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Before the outbreak, the experiments went further, didn't they? Those... ceiling-crawlers out there.. .

Speaker: ada
Dialogue: The product of human DNA spliced with the DNA of vicious carnivores... animals, even insects. Plated with armor, beneath newly cultivated skin. Then... injected with poison, so their biological components would die.

Speaker: jill
Dialogue: Die.

Speaker: ada
Dialogue: The "T"-virus reactivates them in a matter of minutes, but... in battle, lost minutes are... inconvenient. So, the B.O.W.s had to die... and be allowed to revive before they could be used to... full advantage. They were murdered... by their own people... so they could never be murdered again... by the enemy.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Were any more of these...weapons... developed?

Speaker: wesker
Dialogue: HOW DO WE GET INTO "D" LAB?

Speaker: ada
Dialogue: You don't.

Speaker: wesker
Dialogue: How fortunate... that I am.

Speaker: ada
Dialogue: Have...you been leaving doors open?

Speaker: jill
Dialogue: Yes.

Speaker: ada
Dialogue: This place is going to be overrun by...

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: Brad's in really bad shape.

Speaker: vickers
Dialogue: One...of the sharks. Its teeth. I Just...brushed up against its teeth...after it was dead.

Speaker: ada
Dialogue: Shoot him. Somebody, shoot him!

Speaker: jill
Dialogue: No! We're so close. The antidote.

Speaker: barry
Dialogue: What's got into you man? This... this isn't like you.

Speaker: wesker
Dialogue: Oh, yes, this is exactly like me.

Speaker: rodriguez
Dialogue: You know how to use that thing, chica?

Speaker: ada
Dialogue: Of course I do. I'm a scientist.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: No! You can't! Not while there's still a chance to save him!

Speaker: wesker
Dialogue: It's called... the Tyrant. Nobody knows it exists. Except us... and Holden.

Speaker: barry
Dialogue: Holden?

Speaker: wesker
Dialogue: Umbrella's man in D.C. We need him. He signs the checks.  We've got it, Barry! Our fortune!

Speaker: barry
Dialogue: You're not gonna try to get this big mother outta here ?

Speaker: wesker
Dialogue: Don't have to. All we need is the data. Then.. .these things can be cranked out on an assembly line!

Speaker: barry
Dialogue: What about the antidote?

Speaker: wesker
Dialogue: Antidote?  There is no antidote. That was just happy horse shit, to keep the team going.

Speaker: barry
Dialogue: You're gonna give this to Umbrella?

Speaker: wesker
Dialogue: No. I'm gonna sell it to them. Then I'm gonna open a Swiss bank account... right next to yours.

Speaker: wesker
Dialogue: It's real, alright. And it's worth... more than gold. More than uranium!

Speaker: rodriguez
Dialogue: Do we get a piece of that action?

Speaker: wesker
Dialogue: All of you do. Anyone who comes out of this alive... gets a taste.

Speaker: wesker
Dialogue: Anybody else see it my way?

Speaker: ada
Dialogue: You disgrace yourself!

Speaker: toshiro
Dialogue: I...I want to live.

Speaker: wesker
Dialogue: Smart. Anyone else? Valentine?

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: And I was gonna try to disarm the bomb. This place should be destroyed! It needs to be destroyed!

Speaker: wesker
Dialogue: Gotcha, son. It's only because of Valentine, here, that I didn't squeeze the trigger.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: If she's on your side... she doesn't mean shit to me. And I don't mean shit to her.

Speaker: jill
Dialogue: Chris, please. There's only... one way to go, here .

Speaker: wesker
Dialogue: That's right. My way!

Speaker: jill
Dialogue: Yes, sir. Your way!

Speaker: barry
Dialogue: You shoot. I shoot, boss.

Speaker: jill
Dialogue: We believed in you. I believed in you. Boy, was I a sucker.

Speaker: ada
Dialogue: Get out! Now! Or you never will!

Speaker: rodriguez
Dialogue: So... we'll live here!  No. The landlord looks like a sonuvabitch.

Speaker: ada
Dialogue: I TOLD YOU... TO SHOOT HIM!

Speaker: jill
Dialogue: Everybody! OUT!

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Thirteen minutes.

Speaker: barry
Dialogue: Go.

Speaker: jill
Dialogue: LOOK OUT!

Speaker: wesker
Dialogue: Get me outta here, Redfield. Or so help me God, you're a dead man.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Get going.

Speaker: jill
Dialogue: Not without...

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: MOVE!

Speaker: wesker
Dialogue: COME BACK! RODRIGUEZ! VALENTINE! THAT'S AN ORDER !

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Orders don't mean shit any more, Wesker. Especially when they come from sell-out bastards like you.

Speaker: wesker
Dialogue: B-buddy. You gotta get us out.

Speaker: barry
Dialogue: Not sure I know how, boss. Do you? Is there some other...'need-to-know' secret for shutting down the Big Bopper, here?

Speaker: wesker
Dialogue: No. It.. it can't be shut down.

Speaker: barry
Dialogue: The ultimate warrior. The ultimate soldier. We'll see. How it does against a couple of hard-ass career guys, like you and me.

Speaker: ada
Dialogue: The corridor outside... can be moved.

Speaker: ada
Dialogue: You won't come out in the same place. But you'll find a freight loader that can be accessed with...

Speaker: jill
Dialogue: ...a blue key. I hope.

Speaker: ada
Dialogue: No. Pot blue or green. Red.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Red... overrides green.

Speaker: ada
Dialogue: Yes.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: So... you could have unlocked "D" lab.

Speaker: ada
Dialogue: I was hoping it would never be un- locked again. Go. I will see that this.. . ... is destroyed.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: It's destroyed. It's worthless But you're not.

Speaker: ada
Dialogue: I helped develop it!

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Unwittingly. They lied to you. They lied to Marcus. They made you believe you were doing a good thing when it wasn't good at all. It was evil!

Speaker: ada
Dialogue: Stand up? Against powers that have... ruled the world since before we were born? We will only be...eliminated. Or locked away someplace else. I'd rather die here. Knowing that the virus has died with me .

Speaker: jill
Dialogue: What if it's already spread? You're the only one...who knew anything about it.

Speaker: ada
Dialogue: But, I... know so little.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: More than anyone else. You have... a responsibility.

Speaker: jill
Dialogue: To a higher command. The highest.

Speaker: barry
Dialogue: That's one helluva big pump.

Speaker: wesker
Dialogue: An implant.

Speaker: barry
Dialogue: From what? A fuckin' elephant?

Speaker: wesker
Dialogue: Rhinoceros.

Speaker: barry
Dialogue: Shit. I figured you knew more than you were telling.

Speaker: wesker
Dialogue: I told you, we don't. W-we can't. It's unstoppable!

Speaker: ada
Dialogue: I don't know if I can face this.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Just get us upstairs. I'll take care of it from there.

Speaker: ada
Dialogue: Alright.  Come.

Speaker: ada
Dialogue: Doors... were left open.

Speaker: ada
Dialogue: Step on.

Speaker: jill
Dialogue: I don't know if it's gonna happen.

Speaker: rodriguez
Dialogue: Come on. I been waitin' all day for somthin. like this.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: You're up.

Speaker: rodriguez
Dialogue: I'm havin' too much fun. You got a lady. I just got me. Anyway... I ain't gonna die in this rat hole. I'll make it. Get outta here.

Speaker: ada
Dialogue: Level "C". Have your weapons ready.

Speaker: rodriguez
Dialogue: Whoop-de-doo.

Speaker: barry
Dialogue: Get under a desk, man. I'm gonna feed this thing a pineapple.

Speaker: wesker
Dialogue: NO! It might damage the system! I've got to get this data!

Speaker: barry
Dialogue: Forget it. Bullets don't work!

Speaker: wesker
Dialogue: They seem to work just fine.

Speaker: ada
Dialogue: Level "B".

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: Don't see anything.

Speaker: ada
Dialogue: Good.

Speaker: ada
Dialogue: We're almost there. You'll have to jump off. The belt won't stop.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: Bats! There are bats in here!

Speaker: ada
Dialogue: No. They're crows! Infected! Don't let them bite you!

Speaker: rodriguez
Dialogue: Rats. FLYING RATS!

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: You alright?

Speaker: rodriguez
Dialogue: Yeah. I'm cool. I'm... cool.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: I thought it wasn't supposed to stop.

Speaker: ada
Dialogue: Climb out. OUT!

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: ROSIE!?

Speaker: rodriguez
Dialogue: I'M ALRIGHT!

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Climb, Rosie!

Speaker: rosie
Dialogue: No. I'm finished. I live here now.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: ROSIE, NOOOOO!

Speaker: rosie
Dialogue: EAT ME, YOU PILE OF SHIT!

Speaker: ada
Dialogue: Come.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: ROSIE ...

Speaker: ada
Dialogue: COME! You convinced me that there were...larger matters. We're at the top. You said you'd get us out.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Th-this way.

Speaker: rebecca
Dialogue: Hell of a shit-house.

Speaker: jill
Dialogue: The guy was a bootlegger... with a sense of humor.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: I hope they haven't disabled this.

Speaker: laguardia
Dialogue: I'm goin' in.

Speaker: radio man
Dialogue: You don't have authority.

Speaker: laguardia
Dialogue: Fuck authority.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Watch it. WATCH IIIIT!

Speaker: radio
Dialogue: What in God's name is that thing!

Speaker: laguardia
Dialogue: Somethin' we weren't supposed to see. Drop the ladder. And drop the Stinger.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: GET UP!

Speaker: radio man
Dialogue: Catch this!

Speaker: jill
Dialogue: Toss it to me!

Speaker: jill
Dialogue: We have to get out of range.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: No.  Circle around.

Speaker: laguardia
Dialogue: Are there more survivors?

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: No. Just...circle, okay? I want to...take a last look.

Speaker: jill
Dialogue: It's... your home.

Speaker: jill
Dialogue: I guess... we're gonna be moving.

Speaker: chris
Dialogue: Full throttle. Out of here, man!
